column4: can someone tell me how to upgrade ubuntu to lastest version?
i'm using 12.04lts
i think the latest is 12.10
what are you trying to get out of upgrading, out of curiosity?
i dont know , base on my thinking, latest always good isin't it/
maybe something news add on?
well...how to upgrade

No. Stable is always good. The latest bleeding edge release is not "always" good. Moving from LTS to latest is not clever imho, unless something you have isn't working and you need support for brand new hw that is not avail in LTS... but that is my opinion.
so no upgrade?
i have image the current one
i still love to try out though
how come i dont see upgrade to 12.010
it said ur system is up to date
phong if you just want to try it, install a virtual machine and load in there inside your stable install.
upgrading is a one way ticket.
find ./* -iname uncompressed.js -exec echo "rm {}" /;          remove the echo and quotes to execute. That will just tell you what it is going to do as it sits.
er... dont need that *
I did -exec rm because when I am blowing things up, I like an echo first to make sure I didn't do something stupid.
i'm in progress of updating now
hope nothing blow up
is red-hat differ from ubuntu?
i know both are linux os

Yes... they are different animals. Ubuntu uses the debian packaging manager(dpkg) and redhat uses the redhat package manager (RPM). This is the fundamental difference which sets the other differences in motion.
and which is better?
